creator: JulianJones2000@yahoo.co.uk
text:
Our server-side application uses POI 1.5.1 to generate Excel files, 
which are then streamed over HTTP to the browser. Generally this process
works fine, but some streamed files cause Excel to crash. The crash does
not appear to be version-specific (we see the same results in Excel 97 and
Excel XP). The Excel document generated always has 2 worksheets. We see
the crash typically when there are > 300 rows and > 150 columns in one of
the worksheets. I have read bug reports that Excel will crash if > 256
columns are used, but this is not the case for our worksheets.
All our cell values are written as Strings. We don't use formulas or any other
of the more sophisticated Excel facilities.
I will attach an example file that exhibits this problem.

creator: JulianJones2000@yahoo.co.uk
text:
Created attachment 7079
A sample Excel file generated by POI that will crash Excel when it tries to load it

creator: dmui@apache.org
text: Have you attempted to use 2.0pre?  1.5 is quite old.

creator: poi-support@buni.org
text:
I suspect this is fixed in the 2.0-pre2 as soon as its released.  We're nearing release of 
2.0 and so all bug fixes are going into that release.

creator: poi-support@buni.org
text: information asked for but not given.
Even with 2.0-pre3 files larger than 1MB crash with Excel.
creator: gr28@lucent.com

text:
please attach the minimum simplest amount of code necessary to reproduce it with a main (or as a 
junit test case, better yet).  It's not the file size, I generate files >1mb all the time.  File size is the 
most frequent red herring.  Certain bugs or conditions just happen mroe in big files.
creator: poi-support@buni.org

text:
Created attachment 7769
POITest.java with rows 0-821 creates files not loadable with Excel 2000 (9.0.3821 SR-1)
creator: gr28@lucent.com
gr28@lucent.com
text:
the only workaround is to load the Excel file with Open Office and to save it 
again.

But still that's not sufficient.

creator: gr28@lucent.com
text:
Created attachment 7801
output Excel file generated from POITest

creator: avik@apache.org
text:
tested the code attached with latest CVS,  and the file opens perfectly in Excel XP

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 15375 ***
